The company said after a months-long review of alternatives for Qdoba, including a sale or spinoff, it determined a sale was "the best alternative for enhancing shareholder value, and is consistent with the company's desire to transition to a less capital-intensive business model," Chief Executive Lenny Comma said.
Jack in the Box Inc. JACK, +0.16% said Tuesday it agreed to sell its Mexican food fast-casual subsidiary Qdoba Restaurants Corp. to Apollo Global Management LLC APO, -2.43% for $305 million in cash.
Jack in the Box expects to use the proceeds of the deal, which is expected to close by April 2018, to pay down debt.
Jack's stock has lost 10% year to date through Monday, while the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33% has rallied 20%.
ET, while Apollo's stock was still inactive in premarket trade.
The fast-food burger chain had bought Qdoba in 2003.
